001/**
002 * This class is part of the RPandaScape application. 
003 * RPandaScape is a very simple, text based adventure game.  
004 * 
005 * This class holds an enumeration table of all command words known to the game.
006 * It is used to recognise commands as they are typed in.
007 *
008 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes + D.Bureau + Elie Duboux
009 * @version 2008.03.30 + 2019.09.25 + 2021.12.12
010 */
011public class CommandWords
012{
013    /**
014     * A constant array that will hold all valid command words
015     */
016    private static final String[] aValidCommands = {
017        "go", "quit", "help", "look", "eat", "back", "test", "take", "drop", "inventory",
018    };
019
020    /**
021     * Constructor - initialise the command words.
022     */
023    public CommandWords()
024    {
025        // nothing to do at the moment...
026    } // CommandWords()
027
028    /**
029     * Check whether a given String is a valid command word. 
030     * @param pString The String.
031     * @return True if a given string is a valid command,
032     * false if it isn't.
033     */
034    public boolean isCommand( final String pString )
035    {
036        for ( int i=0; i<this.aValidCommands.length; i++ ) 
037        {
038            if ( this.aValidCommands[i].equals( pString ) )
039                return (true);
040        } // for
041        // if we get here, the string was not found in the commands
042        return (false);
043    }//isCommand()
044    
045    /**
046     * Get the allowed commands.
047     * @return The String of the allowed commands.
048     */
049    public String getCommandList()
050    {
051        StringBuilder vValidCommands = new StringBuilder();
052        for(String vCommand : aValidCommands)
053            vValidCommands.append(vCommand + " ");
054        
055        System.out.println();
056        return (vValidCommands.toString());
057    }//getCommandList()
058}//CommandWords
